Define a 4-bit register to hold the current value of the shift register/counter.

Retrieved Related Information:
q: 4-bit output of the shift register. (Type:Signal)
When shift_ena is 1, data is shifted into the shift register most-significant-bit first. (Type:StateTransition)
When count_ena is 1, the number in the shift register is decremented. (Type:StateTransition)

Implement logic to shift data into the 4-bit register most-significant-bit first when shift_ena is high. This involves taking the current value of the data input and shifting it into the most significant bit of the register, while shifting the other bits to the right.

Retrieved Related Information:
- shift_ena: Enable signal for shifting data into the shift register. (Type:Signal)
- data: Input data bit for the shift register. (Type:Signal)
- q: 4-bit output of the shift register. (Type:Signal)
- When shift_ena is 1, data is shifted into the shift register most-significant-bit first. (Type:StateTransition)
source: Data is shifted in most-significant-bit first when shift_ena is 1.
